video.title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

timeline_events.event_description: NSO Group was founded by three individuals.
A list of approximately 50,000 phone numbers, spanning 2016 to 2020, was compiled, potentially linked to Pegasus targets.
International journalists convened in Paris during the COVID crisis to plan the 'Global Spyware Scandal, exposing Pegasus' investigation.
A large-scale investigation involving over 80 journalists commenced to identify names behind phone numbers and conduct forensics.
Claudio Guarnieri, head of Amnesty International's Security Lab, developed a methodology and platform for analyzing phones for Pegasus infection.
The first part of the 'Global Spyware Scandal, exposing Pegasus' investigation was set for publication.

temporal_patterns.description: Pegasus spyware has been continuously used globally to monitor and track journalists, human rights activists, and dissidents.
temporal_patterns.significance: Highlights the persistent and widespread threat of the technology's abuse.

temporal_patterns.description: NSO Group claims to have found only three cases of misuse of their technology in the last 10 years, which reportedly led to system shutdowns.
temporal_patterns.significance: Presents NSO's narrative on managing misuse, contrasting with widespread reports of abuse.

temporal_patterns.description: A significant shift occurred in journalistic practices, moving from traditional rivalry among news organizations to unprecedented global collaboration for this investigation.
temporal_patterns.significance: Marks a new approach to international investigative journalism for high-impact global stories.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Specific to the Pegasus investigation (approx. July 2020 - July 2021)

temporal_patterns.description: Israel has progressed to become a global leader in the cyber surveillance industry, with NSO Group being a prominent example.
temporal_patterns.significance: Contextualizes NSO's success within a broader national trend in technology.

temporal_patterns.description: The Guardian had been reporting on NSO Group for a long time prior to this joint international investigation.
temporal_patterns.significance: Indicates prior awareness and long-standing concern regarding NSO's activities among certain news outlets.
